content.question: If the marginal revenue of the <math alttext="two hundred first" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>201</mn><mtext>st</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> unit of output is <math alttext="$15" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">$</mi><mn>15</mn></math> and the marginal cost of the <math alttext="two hundred first" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>201</mn><mtext>st</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> unit is <math alttext="$20" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">$</mi><mn>20</mn></math>, the total economic profit of producing <math alttext="201" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>201</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> units will be

unit.text: 3: Production, Cost, and the Perfect Competition Model

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Determine the effect(s) of a change in an economic situation using quantitative data or calculations.
